intro: Alyxia reinwardtii var. insularis, commonly known as the island alyxia, is a flowering plant native to specific tropical regions. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its woody stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow. It thrives in humid, well-drained soils and is often found in coastal or lowland areas. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species in its native habitat.
